title: Great practice
body: I had a very good experience with this practice. All the practitioners I saw took the time to discuss in detail my concerns and they did their best to help. I would recommend this practice to anyone.

title: excellent service
body: Saw doctor and nurse today for health check and appt with doctor very satisfied with the treatment I received from both. Its good to be with a practice that gives such an excellent service from reception, and medical staff. Thoroughly recommend this great practice

title: Kind and reassuring
body: We just wanted to say a big ‘thank you’ for the supportive service my mum received when having a home visit from Oxenhope Pharmacy for a covid jab. The nurse was so kind and put my mum at ease straight away, making her feel relaxed, comfortable and reassured, even the jab was painless! Thank you so much for being so understanding and helping her to stay calm, you made it all so easy.

author: phasekp57
title: Upset by the lack of support
body:
I gave birth to my son in 2021, this was my first pregnancy so I was nervous and excited for his birth and hoping for a good birth experience. Unfortunately he had Strep B when he was born which I understand is no one’s fault. However, it could have been picked up on early in my pregnancy by a simple swab. It was very upsetting to find out the NHS no longer offers these swabs in pregnancy. I felt let down that my son was ill with something potentially so serious when it was completely avoidable.  
During my labour my temperature spiked extremely high and both myself and my son had to be given antibiotics. Bloods were also taken from my son which was when the Strep B was found. Bloods were taken regularly from my son for the remainder of our time in the hospital and my son was frequently returned to me with blood on his clothes and not dressed properly. Having my son constantly taken away was very difficult for me and it was made worse by the lack of care shown to him when he was away from me.  
When I gave birth (Nov 2021), the hospital was still operating Covid visiting. While I understand the desire to limit infection I don’t think my needs as a new mother were considered. All new mothers need support after giving birth and I particularly needed it as I was so unwell myself. I now know that I had sepsis but this was not communicated to me at any stage of my stay in hospital and I only found out 18 months later when another doctor saw it in my notes. Only two 2 hour visits were permitted each day which left me completely alone with my new baby 20 hours a day. This made it very difficult for me and my partner to bond with our son as he has such limited time with us and I was trying to recover myself.  
I was understandly upset by the lack of support I had and my son being ill, however, when I tried to express this to midwives I was told to get a grip as other people had it worse. At the time I was too unwell to really take it in, but looking back this is appalling from the staff who are meant to be supporting new mothers. Unfortunately, this behaviour wasn’t a one off, I was made to feel embarrassed and weak by staff for wanting support either from them or my partner. Staff also made me feel like I was a bad mum when I asked about when my son and I would be able to go home. I was told I need to take Strep B seriously as a baby downstairs had just died from it. This was extremely upsetting as I didn’t even want to consider the possibility that my baby would die and the only reason I had asked about going home was because I was struggling so badly with the isolation of being in hospital, not because I believe Strep B to be a minor illness.  
I found most midwives to be very unhelpful and would take hours to bring basic things like milk. While I absolutely understand how busy a maternity ward is, I don't feel it's acceptable to be without such basic essentials for so long. After a few days my partner started to buy ready made milk and bring it to the hospital as it was clear we couldn’t rely on the midwives in the ward.  
The situation became so bad that my family contacted the ward during my stay because they were so concerned for my mental health. Following this, staff did allow my partner to stay but it was made very clear to us that this was an inconvenience despite me having being in a single room for my whole stay.  
Communication between staff on the ward was also terrible. With every shift change I would have to explain my situation over again, this was very frustrating as it felt like the staff were unprepared and relying on patients to provide information.  
This experience has left me with extreme anxiety surrounding hospitals and I now cannot enter a hospital on my own without experiencing panic attacks. This has meant that when I had my second child recently I did everything possible to try to ensure we wouldn’t be kept in hospital as I was terrified of experiencing the same situation again.  
On top of the other issues, the food was very poor. I am vegetarian and have an allergy to beans and chickpeas and at one point the only meal offered to me was a cold salad consisting of iceberg lettuce and chopped boiled egg. This doesn’t really constitute a full meal under the best of circumstances and certainly not in winter for someone who has just given birth and was unwell. My family had to bring us meals every day, often a takeaway, which was expensive and not very healthy but was at least warm and filling.  
Overall, I have been left with no faith in the maternity unit at QEUH and a poor impression of NHS maternity care overall.

author: Yorks
title: Poor communication and staff behavior
body:
My dad was taken in to A&E by ambulance from a community hospital. He has been completely fine and prob the best he has been in a long time.  
We were extremely worried. When I got to A&E and spoke to my dad he was in the ambulance assessment part. My dad wanted some water as he was running a fever. I went to ask one of the nurses who was polite and said to wait until they had had his blood drawn. I asked the nurse if I needed to be worried. They said they didn’t know and asked the nurse in charge next to them. This nurse turned around and said - he’s only been in the department for 17 mins. Said in a tone that was like how stupid are you, I told them I didn’t appreciate being spoken to like that and walked away because I was so angry at being spoken to like that. I had no info about why he was there really apart from a fever. I was very worried for my dad and if he had been in the department for that length of time I would hope that they would have known if he was dangerously ill.  
I returned to my dad's cubicle and said what had happened. The nurse in charge came over and basically told me I was being confrontational and I should leave the department. I said I walked away from the situation - that’s not confrontational. The nurse said I have witnesses and cameras. I was so angry at them and in total disbelief at their behaviour. I said I didn’t like the way they spoke to me and said I am worried. I use my hands to talk to explain etc, and their response was - don’t point your fingers at me. The nurse tried to make me leave and made my father distressed. I feel they were totally inappropriate and bullied me. I was remarkably calm because if I hadn’t of been focused on my dad I would have said more to them.  
I understand the pressures, I understand they get abused by people. I think this nurse had decided I was going to do that and treated me like an aggressive person. I am far from that. I have no doubt they judged me but also they were totally inappropriate to speak to me how they did - I feel they then were out of control and on a power trip trying to make me leave when I had walked away from the situation. This distressed us as a family. A friend of mine walked in and saw me crying and heard what was going on and gave me a hug. The nurse flipped to being sympathetic and getting me a tissue. Like seriously. I am so upset and angry now by their behaviour.  
Fast forward to my dad being in a cubicle and had his blood pressure taken which we could see was very low. A nurse walked in and was like - we are just going to move him to resus because of his blood pressure. We were shown to a relatives room and said someone would come and to give them 5 mins. 45 agonising mins later my brother went to look for someone. He came back and said the nurse meant to tell us he had been moved to HDU where my dad was sat up and talking away. We had been fearing the worst for all that time and not one word of communication.  
We asked about his condition numerous times and were told someone would come and they never did. I don’t fault their clinical care but their treatment of us was not good at all. Caused us far more worry and stress. We finally found out after about 5 hours or more that he had sepsis. They seemed matter of fact that he would have IV antibiotics and fluids for 48 hours and return to the community rehab hospital. My father has many complex medical problems and has been in hospital for 6 months. He has been given CPE and VRE by BRI and ended up with sepsis.  
Having been around a hospital for 6 months, the one thing I would never do is be confrontational to staff. I believe the NHS is broken and the care patients get sometimes is totally below basic human need. I have seen the stress and upset this causes nurses and how hard they work. I have been encouraging, grateful and have always tried to build the nurses up with my words. For that nurse in charge to speak to me and behave how they did was disgusting and threatening, in my view. I feel that to leave us in a relatives room with no communication is disgusting.  
You looked after my dad and got him sorted - was there more that could have been done - yes, we had to keep asking for him to get assistance. It seems to me that the staff are quite clearly burned out, and I get that, but that day was a dark day in our family and the staff seemed completely devoid of any understanding or empathy for that. I felt like we were just a case, a job, a number - we were not a family worried about their dad and my dad was not a person, just a case, a condition to be managed.  
I am thankful for the clinical care and for giving him the treatment quickly, but they caused us and my dad distress with their lack of communication and behaviour.

readBy.name: Bradford Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: zuluxr64
title: The service was excellent
body: I attended the New Victoria Hospital for a bronchoscopy yesterday, the service was excellent. Everyone from the nursing staff, HCA's, medical and reception staff were very friendly and showed great care. Couldn't of asked for a better service.

author: Stravaig65
title: The whole team were fabulous
body:
Apprehensive. I have recently been involved in medical tests following a slightly elevated PSA level. Following a recent MRI, during which I was also looked after very well I was contacted by the appointments secretary of the Urology clinic, who offered me a TRUS biopsy appointment that afternoon. I was looked after by five staff, including the person at Urology reception, two of whom, whose names have slipped my mind.  
Consultant Joby, Student Nurse Alison and Nurse Ruth.  
Mr?/Dr? Taylor explained the procedure, and although was very swift and softly spoken in his delivery, I could pick out the salient points and give my permission for the procedure to go ahead. He informed me prior to any actions taking place throughout and any sensations I might be aware of, although I was trying to distract myself by chatting away to Alison.  
Alison looked after me wonderfully, and chatted away with me through out the whole procedure, although I doubt she got much of a chance to speak as I tend to talk too much or not at all in a stressful situation. On this occasion it was the former. The procedure was completed and Ruth came into the room and I chatted with both her and Alison, probably sharing too much, and I was given instructions as to what was required of me, regarding booking a results appointment and and what to expect from my body following the biopsy with regard to bleeding etc.  
I was also given an information sheet to take away with me Re: signs and symptoms to look out for should there be any side effects.  
The whole team were fabulous and I felt informed and put at ease regarding the whole procedure. Having formerly worked in the NHS myself some years ago, I felt that Alison's patient care skills, went above and beyond, the others performed professionally and with respect, making me feel safe and involved in the procedure.  
Thank you Scottish National Health Service.  
[Very happy with 'Staff attitude']  
  
[Very happy with 'Staff skills']  
  
[Very happy with 'Treatment']  
  
[Very happy with 'Seeing the whole me']  
  
[Very happy with 'Pain relief']  
  
[Very happy with 'Medication']  
  
[Very happy with 'Introductions']  
  
[Very happy with 'Explanations']  
  
[Very happy with 'Being listened to']  
  
[Very happy with 'Nurses']  
  
[Very happy with 'Doctor']  
  
[Very happy with 'Other staff']  
  
[Very happy with 'Future plans']  
  
[Very happy with 'Involved in decisions']  
  
[Very happy with 'Team work']  
  
[Very happy with 'Waiting time']  
  
[Very happy with 'Environment']  
  
[Very happy with 'Appointments']  
  
[Very happy with 'Reception']  
  
[Very happy with 'Toilet']  
  
[Very happy with 'Cleanliness']  
  
[Very happy with 'Finding your way']  
  
[Very happy with 'Liquid']

author: FUS 1220
title: The whole thing went like clockwork
body: Very well run. Staff made you feel at ease, the whole thing went like clockwork. They really knew their job cannot praise them enough, thank you for a good job.

author: Rvp5123
title: I am really grateful for the support given
body:
Inclusion Thurrock has been very supportive and given me the opportunity to use their services to learn different interventions to support me overcome some of my anxiety symptoms.  
Setting my goals helped to address and improve my motivation and reviewing it with my therapist from time to time helped to address the next step for me.  
The CBT sessions/ topics were beneficial. I benefitted from the different topics. I learned various tools and techniques which I have to make it a regular part of my routine to help me overcome my anxiety.  
Having Megan as one of the facilitators during the sessions and working with her 1-1 has provided me ongoing support to help me work towards achieving my goals.  
Megan made me realise that not doing things make one pay attention to the thoughts we have. Then it affects us more. Through her modelling, giving tasks and providing reassurance, I was determined to start doing things. I learned to build my routine, breaking down tasks so that they are realistic and achievable. Now I have something to look forward to do everyday. I am really grateful for the support given.

title: Used to be?
body: I needed advice from a doctor but didn't get one face to face on the same day i called 8am was told to ring back Wednesday, after a spinal operation having trouble with walking, but willing to go with a friend for support in mobility was told by young receptionist to call back Wednesday this is disgusting after being there for 40 yrs. I couldn't see a G.P. my view in this situation was bad advice from staff, especially younger receptionist. Disgusting someone from management should look into this if long term patients remain their.

title: Extremely poor people skills
body: The patient was made to feel like they were wasting the doctors time. They were scoffed at, dismissed, and what they said was barely acknowledged. The patient booked the appointment because they were genuinely concerned, it is an absolute disgrace to treat vunerable people in this manner.

title: Accessibility
body:
This has been my GP surgery for many years and I am generally very satisfied with the swift appointments available and the service of care given my the clinicians and GPS.

What I would like to bring to attention is the accessibility in this surgery. Recently due to mobility issues I have had to attend the surgery with both crutches and on a wheelchair a few times. Although there is step free access and a lift, my issue is with the doors on this route. Both the external and the second internal door are very old style push/pull doors which are also quite stiff and heavy. They also close back quite quickly so to stop them from closing back in you just as soon as you’ve opened them I had to hold them open with my body. I realise this is quite an outdated and troublesome system. I would expect the doors to be automatic or at least power or push button assisted for those with any accessibility or mobility issues.

title: It access
body:
What a great idea get you prescriptions online book appointments great!
But it's not because it simply does not work constant requests to change your details because surprise it doesn't recognize the previous ones that it just asked for.
Repeat prescriptions don't bother mind wasn't even online so had to phone to reorder in diabetic by the way.
Over all this system isn't worth squat it may have been implemented to try and save time and 
Pressure on the practice but it's only served to raise my stress levels beyond belief.
What a complete waste of time and taxpayers money

title: Great Practice
body: Can’t speak highly enough of this practice. Caring and efficient telephone receptionist dealt with my request to see a dr, and the dr I saw was patient, understanding and  arranged the help I needed.

author: Hamish925
title: Delays in critical scan reporting
body:
I was seen by a General Surgery consultant at Inverclyde Royal Hospital. My symptoms pointed to a partial blockage of my small intestine. I was told that whilst they could go in blind, it would be better to have a CT scan before and a request for an urgent appointment would be made.  
[Unhappy with 'Being listened to']  
The next day I was able to get a cancelled appointment at Gartnavel General. The CT scan was done and I was told that a report would be sent to my consultant.  
[Unhappy with 'Calling for help']  
  
My queries are:  
1. Are all reports subject to a greater than 7 day delay in reporting?  
2. What is a typical wait time between CT scan and reporting?  
3. What is the typical wait time between an urgent CT scan referral and an appointment being made and/or taking place?  
[Unsure about 'Explanations']  
  
As of 23/05/23 no report has reached them.

title: Lovely staff but wait too long
body:
The staff were lovely, but the wait times are too long. More funding for all hospital A&E departments is needed.
Went in with chest pain, 5 hours later bloods and ecg done but no doctor seen. 
Ended up discharging myself due to negative impact on mental health. Figured if wait was gonna be another 2 hours (at least) then there couldn't be anything too urgent.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Dorset NHS Foundation Trust

author: fornaxwn56
title: She was very kind
body:
I have used this service before, for my carers, although after my recent visit, I want to share my view on my experience with the lovely Claire from the office.  
I was very worried at first when she contacted me about the visit, but she was able to calm me down and made it clear why she was wanting to come.  
The day of the visit went really well, she was very kind, listened to my moans and groans of life, gave me advice and explained the service - something I had never had fully explained to me. She is also very proud of the carers, as am I. I do hope she visits me again. Thank you.

readBy.name: South Ayrshire Health and Social Care Partnership

title: Online consultation never available
body: The website has a link to "Consult GP online" however it is closed down and tge message on screen always says it will be open tomorrow at 8am....tomorrow never comes as same message appears every day!

title: Fantastic service
body: I had a fall last year and broke my wrist in 3 places, went to South shields A&E and ease seen quite quickly, had manipulation and plaster cast put on, however I was recalled the next day for an operation to put pins in and replanted, despite still working under covid restrictions the staff were wonderful, at no stage could I fault my treatment. This is a vital service that our community depends on.

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: Bad practice
body: Waiting for 25 min to answer the fone and after that the receptionist don’t know nothing completely useless will look for another place

title: Worth more than gold
body:
The ladies that looked after me on my daily visit to them in Rochester, for my Picc line antibiotics, I have no words really to say how amazing their team are. Apart from the fact that they are reassuring, empathetic, kind, amazing and they are worth more than gold. You're not just another person waiting to be seen, they make you feel like an individual that's noticed and cared for. 
I can't thank them enough for making my 2 weeks daily visits a friendly place to be.  One that nerves aren't needed as they have this calmness about them that helps you relax. 
Thank you for looking after me and for the amazing job you all do. Keep being the lovely people you all are.

title: Everything superb
body: From arriving at the hospital to leaving later the same day having had cataract surgery the whole experience was faultless. The hospital was spotless and everyone from the Receptionist, the nurses, the team where I had the surgery were polite and professional.. Everything was explained to me very clearly and I was relaxed during the whole experience. After surgery the food I ordered beforehand arrived immediately and was delicious. Congratulations Ashtead you exceeded expectations.

title: So so disappointing
body: I am always waiting hours to see doctor, it always happens to be my little ones have lowest priorities, people coming and prioritises over us for no good reason, admin staff are not respectful and caring at all! Very very disappointing experience

title: Long waiting times
body: I saw a GP who recommended blood tests for suspected anaemia. The waiting time for blood tests is currently one month which is an unacceptable long wait too assist in a diagnosis. Maybe the GPs should consider employing another phlebotomist.

title: Supportive Staff
body: Having been many times to Iver Medical Centre recently. I can not praise the Reception staff for being so helpful and the two Doctors dealing with me for listening to me, helping me and caring for me. These two Doctors have been so very good at dealing with my many health issues.

author: Jonny273
title: Liver Transplant
body:
After suffering from Auto Immune Hepatitis and a rare Liver condition called PSC I unfortunately got end stage liver disease were by I had to go on the liver transplant list.  
Whilst waiting on the list my health deteriorated so badly I was in hospital more than I was at home. I am married, good job and have a 4-year-old son. Our whole lives got put on hold and it was extremely challenging. My wife and son have been incredible throughout this and shown real strength whilst I deteriorated.  
I finally got my Transplant May 2023. The operation was hard but I managed to get through it and I am now finally home with a long road ahead for recovery.  
I count my blessings I am here to enjoy life and when better start planning exciting holidays etc.... It's been quite the experience but I am determined & focused to get better and start being a husband & daddy again

title: Poor
body: Arrived in A and E with fast heart rate , taken in and decided procedure required to address. Moved to another area awaiting further investigation. Very good nurse came outlined everything but said long delay, still very fast heart rate. After several hours no sign procedure could be done. Told Incould wait further several hours or wait longer to be admitted, really feeling bad by now and fed up. Said I would be called about procedure to do urgently to slow .. went home disallusioned and v tired as feel like I’m constantly running marathon. Still awaiting notification

author: Peg, Glasgow
title: It's been a life changing few weeks
body:
I have had hip and back pain for a long time, and had limited benefit from physio on land, because pain interfered with my ability to complete the exercises. This made me frustrated and disheartened.  
My physio at QEUH referred me to hydrotherapy at RAH, and I waited for a few months to be assessed.  
The staff have been wonderful (special thanks to Alasdair, Caryn & Blair), carefully assessing my needs and my hopes for treatments and adapting my treatment plan to take account of my progress. They put me at ease and quickly identified when to push me and when to hold back a bit.  
I have benefited from using the warm water for pain relief as well as the gentle resistance while doing the exercises, and each week I've gained confidence as well as strength and mobility.  
Things aren't perfect now of course, but it's been a life changing few weeks for me and made me determined to keep getting stronger and moving a little more each week. I'm sorry to have come to the end of my sessions.  
Thanks to all of the staff who helped me through this - just wish more people could have access to this service, which has faced reductions in recent times.

title: Amazing practice
body: This is the first time a GP practice has proactively addressed my needs and the needs of my family. The staff are all very helpful from the reception to nurses, to GPS to pharmacy.

title: Professional & Supportive Team
body:
Thank you to the professional, kind and supportive team at Wokingham medical practice.

The care of my elderly mother with home support was excellent from the admin team who took access details to the nurse who provided the Covid vaccine. 

Thank you.

title: Very pleased
body: Day surgery. From very first entry staff were informative, genuinely caring, friendly, helpful and on hand all the time. They made me welcome and put me at my ease from the start. They were all efficient and caring. Special praise for the team who looked after me post op until I went home. Massive thank you especially my surgeons who I know had a challenge, and she was so nice. 5 out of 5 from me! Recommend

title: Unable to get appointments
body: Recurrently unable to get appointment to see the gp. Call at opening time and lines are at capacity. Within 10 minutes, all appointments are gone and you cannot book for non urgent appointments throughout the week. Advertising that they are accepting new patients but cannot meet the needs of the patients they currently have.

title: Exceptional Practice
body: I find that using the online consultation service is extremely efficient with call back within hours. Friendly staff who I have personally found to be knowledgeable and helpful.

title: Surgery on 09/05/23
body: I had a right side Nephrectomy on 09/05/23.  I would like to thank the Urology team for their kindness and compassion during this difficult time for me.  From my excellent surgeon who I could tell cared about their patients.  To the wonderful nurses on pre-op who I had to see multiple times.

readBy.name: Blackpool Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Phone lines
body: Rang last week was told to ring back today . Got threw dead on 8 am was first thought o brilliant still rirst at 8 30 . Yet they told me I need to ring dead on 8am I do and still no luck

title: Excellent service
body: I had an ear infection. I rang at 8am and was 1 of 15. I waited and was answered within 10 mins. Receptionist was friendly and I was put on the am list for a call. Call was an hr later  and I was seen in person that morning for a diagnosis and medication. Very happy with service I received from all staff who are all working under difficult conditions. Thank you

title: Mixed reviews
body:
I feel like this practice has mixed reviews. Some of the medical staff themselves are brilliant, but the same as every other doctors surgery, getting an appointment is a struggle and even getting hold of them for any other reason can be difficult (especially if you work 8-5 working hours).
I had an appointment recently for a mole removal and the doctor & nurse who did it were absolutely amazing. They gave the best care and told me exactly what was going on so I felt at ease.

title: A Serious Downgrade
body:
I used to rate Field View very highly as a GP practice, a few years ago you knew you would be able to get an appointment, even at short notice.
Since the move to City Healthcare Practice, it now seems impossible to actually get an appointment. Ringing up first thing in the morning and waiting to be told that there have been no appointments released for the day, and that there are none to pre-book is quite frankly unacceptable. What is the point of the practice still existing if it isn't able to be used to by its registered patients?

title: Caring receptionist
body: I called to book a telephone appointment on Tuesday evening unfortunately there were none available. I felt I was at crisis point and was panicking but the extremely caring and understanding receptionist helped calm me and explained how I could get an appointment the next day. Luckily for me I got the same receptionist first thing the next morning and she has arranged for me to talk to the GP, have a NHS Health Check and discuss an on going condition in a future appointment. I am really greatful for the care shown.

author: Susan514
title: I came away very happy
body: I had an appointment with Tabitha and Dr Kyle. My appointment was on time and I was dealt with very thoroughly. I was asked lots of relevant questions and felt like everything was of importance. I had an examination by both Tabitha and Dr Kyle. We have a good discussion of what could be aggravating my symptoms. I came away very happy with their answers and suggestions.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fabulous practice
body: Everyone at this surgery goes above and beyond we are so lucky to have such an amazing and caring group of people

author: Hapmg95
title: The care has been outstanding
body:
I have been receiving care from the OPAT service at St John’s Hospital since January this year. The care that I have received has been outstanding. I have found the staff exceptional in every way. When I have been anxious they have been reassuring and patient with me. Their skills and knowledge is beyond any expectation I may have had. The care and compassion shown to myself has been humbling. I cannot thank the staff enough.  
NHS Lothian’s finest.

title: Friendly and efficient
body: I was called for my three year 'smear test' recently and called to make a booking. I was booked in and got a confirmation text straight away. My appointment was on time, staff were friendly, and everything was explained clearly to me, including results and follow-up.

author: Tony950
title: Grateful for their professionalism and care
body:
I attended the R.V.H. Endoscopy unit for a Colonscopy.  
I was booked in and prepared for the scan promptly and with courtesy.  
The procedure was carried out very professionally by Dr Gilroy ably assisted by Vilma, Elaine, Anna, Ruth, Shona, Stephanie, Jennifer, BJ, Anne, Nuala and Justine.  
I am very grateful for their Professionalism and Care.  
Thank You.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: squatzt75
title: Building social skills and building confidence
body:
I was working with Camille from Perth and Kinross Council, social prescriber, for about 6 months or so. She helped me a lot with my confidence and social skills from our face to face meetings and also the activities provided and suggestions from Camille.  
She was a very nice, caring, understanding and hard working person . I'd give Camille a ten out of ten all round.

readBy.name: Perth and Kinross Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Jean916
title: Felt as if my health was unimportant
body:
I went for my routine breast screening at Larkhall Asda car park.  
When I was getting ready for the procedure I said to the nurse that I hated getting this done. The nurse's reply to me shocked and took me aback. They said that it is an invitation and you don’t need to come.  
I have been in nursing for 40+ years. In this nurse's position, I would have encouraged my patients and repeated the benefits of regular check-ups, not make me feel as if my health was unimportant, though I feel that it was unimportant to them.  
I am really sad that this is what the compassionate caring profession has come to. As a side note, the procedure was fine.

author: cassiopeiarf33
title: A comfortable space to think, chat, laugh and cry
body: I have just finished 6 sessions of counselling at the Fern Centre following breast cancer diagnosis last year. Linda was lovely, kind, empathetic, gentle and probing (!) when she felt I could handle it. All the time providing a safe and comfortable space for me to think, chat, laugh and cry - always making me feel secure and unjudged. It's such a massive help in the healing process after surgery, chemo and radiotherapy and dealing with the ongoing hormone therapy and what that does to your body and mind. Thank you for providing this service free.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great doctors and nurses but horrible reception…
body:
Let me start off this review by saying that the doctors and nurses at this surgery are fantastic - when you can actually get an appointment to see them that is. 

The reception staff at Lea Road are awful and have absolutely no phone manners. They are always abrupt and can’t wait to get you off the phone. Even when giving blood test results over the phone, they are vague and not very helpful but don’t seem to offer an appointment for someone to talk it over with you. The worst of it is though that when you are talking to them, they sigh over the phone. It’s completely off putting and just downright rude. If they don’t like the job, then perhaps they should consider a different career! I would suggest a course in Customer Services or basic phone etiquette asap!

title: waiting times are the problem
body: have no problem with the staff very polite waiting for response is the biggest problem and seeing someone face to face not the same on the phone doctors very good

title: Great practice
body: Appointment was in time.Clinician was friendly and professional. I was kept informed about each stage of the scan.

title: Good Practice
body: I took my smear test in Bellevue clinic and the nurse is explaining about the reason of test very detail before doing the test.

author: Nikki noo
title: The staff were very helpful
body:
I recently had a fistulagram and a fistula plasty. The surgeon and staff in the room were very helpful and put me at ease and talked me through the procedure.  
Very helpful.

author: Sam654
title: SEDS
body:
I feel this has been an absolutely appalling service as a care giver, and I believe my daughter is being let down in worst ways possible. I felt bullied and berated by the OT in day service feeding my daughter dairy, when she’s lactose intolerant and making her poorly. Obviously weight will drop from diarrhea and vomiting. they then threatened to kick her out if weight drops. The service seems to be run by trainees, no breakfast implemented, they are not given choices of what they’d like to cook it’s always the OT wanting the food and snacks, patients opinions are disregarded and if they speak up they are shot down by the OT and shouted at, cupboard doors slammed, huffing and puffing.  
I’ve never liked this service it was a farce first time round 4 years ago it’s even worse now. The patients seem like Guinea pigs for trainees and I’m sick to back teeth of my daughter who speaks, who desperately wants recovery being treat like this.  
I’m am very concenred about this and want to highlight it. A specific therapist over the phone talking to my daughter poorly and in, what I felt was a threatening manner, telling her she shouldn’t talk to her key worker and she’s not to. Luckily for us her psychiatric nurse was there to witness the call.  
Fuming is an understatement.  
I’m sick of hearing changes take time but time is not on the patients side my daughter has already been in ITU and we’ve been warned she won’t survive next time.

readBy.name: Sarah Champion's Office, MP for Rotherham

author: Nikki noo
title: An amazing team
body: I would like to thank all amazing renal team at ward 21, Queen Margaret Hospital.

title: Great practice
body: Very good points doctor was excellent to talk to gave good advice and discussed changes to medication

title: A brilliant nurse
body: I had a smear test last week and the nurse can’t remember her first name her last name was scrace she is the loveliest nurse she made me feel so comfortable and helped me out a lot I appreciate her kind words and she was just lovely so Thankyou!…the surgery itself had cancelled 3 previous appointments for my smear test and overall the surgery isn’t great! That nurse though is a credit to that surgery

title: I was asked to come in 15 minutes early
body:
No explanation as to why. I just sat in the waiting room for an extra 15 minutes of my life I'll never get back. 

Not sure why, but I filled out 3 online and 2 paper questionnaires all covering similar information to do with my appointment. Surely all the questions could be combined in a once and done?

title: Very good
body: I been seen with extra care and responsibility. They are very helpful and friendly. I am glad to join it.

title: Awful
body:
Had a scan almost 3 months ago, no results. The phone number on the NHS website doesn't work. The number given to me by my GP works but then they leave you on hold with a constant 'you are number 1 in the queue' before they hang up on you. A total disregard for people's time and care.
How the hell am I supposed to get my results? Please pelase tell me!

readBy.name: Bradford Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Disappointing
body: Seen 25 mins late for first appointment of the session. Very little help given. Given the impression that restraints of NHS prevented any practical help being offered. When I enquired about various options, I was given vague answers. I had waited 2 months for this appointment. Very disappointed. If effective treatment is only available privately then this should be stated clearly with cost estimates. If the practitioner works privately,then for fairness, a sheet of local practitioners should be provided on a printed sheet with types of treatment available for each with contact details and typical costs.

author: Araem98
title: Has been a great help to me over a number of years
body: I have attended physiotherapy in PRI for many years and Louise and Laura have been extremely good to me, in fact exceptional, with advice, help, exercises to do in the hospital and/or at home. Louise has put me in other health professionals' care as and when it was required and she has been a great help to me over a number of years.

readBy.name: Perth and Kinross Health & Social Care Partnership

title: Lack of Appointments
body: When you have mental health problems, takes loads for someone to accept this and now is ready to go in a journey. Helping me in finding what type of mental illness I have. Doesn't help when you ring and they never have any appointments. Why do I need to ring super early in a morning playing russian roulette in trying to get one of these appointments with the GP. Complete puts you off even trying again as its hard enough ringing and tell the receptionist why you want the appointment to start with.

title: Poor patient care
body: My daughter has been waiting for a referral to gynaecology for 3 months. I cannot get through to the surgery to follow this up.  This really poor service

title: Podiatry 'can't help' message
body: Ringing podiatry, no one to answer. Message prior to answer machine, says 'please be aware our staff might not be able to help you'. Unconceivable for a public service organisation to say this to patients. Very disempowering to staff as well. Even if just to inform, signpost, or even just reassure, staff are able to help.

title: Really disappointed.
body:
Never able to get a face to face appointment with a GP. Still waiting for blood results that were taken end of April and the scheduled call is mid June for the results. My last 2 appointments with a GP where cancelled and booked in with a nurse practitioner who told me I needed to see a GP and a paramedic who was there to take the pressure off the doctors who told me I needed bloods and had to wait 5 weeks for an appointment.
I have not had a proper medication review in 18 months. 
I spent the first 30min calling constantly on redial trying to get through to be told I had to re try in the afternoon as no Dr is available now. I work it's not possible to take 1 hour out of you shift to redial over 100 times to still not get through. 
When you call not in the Dr times the ofter very rude and abrupt reception ask you your medical history resons you want an appointment, refuse to make an appointment, and say the next avaliable one was 9 weeks for a routine appointment - but you need to explain what's wrong and its not routine. So then get told to call in the Dr slots that are twice a day is the best way to get seen and that everyone gets through. It's a total vicious circle. 
It's totally frustrating, don't feel that the care is there. Poor service that needs looking at.

title: Some people don’t know how lucky they are
body:
I have been in a bad way for 20 years now but having toddington medical centre on my side has made my life so much easier, we are blessed in Toddington. I always receive courteous , helpful and empathetic . conversations with the staff and they go the extra mile to make my life easier. Getting results in time for Royal Marsden consultation is sometimes critical and I’m never let down. So grateful am I that I have been known to take in chocolates or flowers. Well done toddington medical centre
Thank you

title: go to A&E instead ...
body: 37th in the telephone que in the morning : out-put = "pre-planned consultations with any of the doctors are booked for a month". Call back after lunch. 1st in the telephone que in the afternoon : out-put = "no slots available". When shall I call back? "use the chat service". Doubt a doctor can diagnose peripheral oedema over a chat service. "call 111" ... Shall I go to A&E instead? ... quite worrying in one of the most affluent Counties in the Country in one of the richest nations in the world. What has my tax been spent on ... should I register elsewhere to see a GP? Does the CQC read these comments? Who will manage the lakeside family care model?

title: Children accident and emergency
body: Went to children’s accident and emergency was seen instantly at the first desk gave a brief explanation of the problem for my son was then sent to wait in the waiting area was called straight in pretty much to get his oxygen levels etc checked, then back to waiting room waited around 20 mins then seen and issue was looked over and resolved very quick and efficient service

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: Superb team fantastic treatment
body:
I’ve been a patient since The end of 2022 with a newly diagnosed condition which I knew nothing about.

Yesterday I turned up for an appointment feeling anxious and in a low mood given my symptoms.

The nurse was just lovely. She took her time, explained things, changed the settings on my machine remotely, discussed other issues, and never once rushed me, even though she’d over run on her time with me.

I cannot praise the team or thank them enough. Everyone provides such a stellar service. Thank you. I left much more hopeful than when I arrived.

title: Worse GP ever
body: Worse GP I’ve ever been to. Phones are never answered, GP always “fully booked” and dismissive front desk. Extremely hard to book appointments. Made several calls at 9am but never get answered. Came to the practice at 9:45 and was told GPs are fully booked. Cannot get any appointments on the other days.

author: Happy mum and dad 2023
title: Pleasant, understanding and supportive
body:
My son has autism. He attended University Hospital Wishaw for day surgery. Things can be tricky for him with regards to the unknown, new surroundings, over stimulated, anxiety, different noises etc.  
All the staff who attended to him from Dr El-Amin, his assistant, Steve, the anaesthetist, nurses Elspeth, Cheryl and all the other nurses (sorry didn't get all their names) were so pleasant, understanding and supportive. I really can't rate them all highly enough.  
We came away feeling he had been so well looked after and that really helped us. Every one of them showed care and understanding, not just for my son but for myself and my husband.  
One of the nurses asked him what he liked and she came back with a printed picture of his favourite football player and cartoon character. He has now asked for it to be put in a frame for his bedroom, he absolutely loves it.  
It's these kind actions which really helped him. So I just felt I needed to highlight our experience.

title: imaging Department Kidderminster
body: Had a CT scan today at 10.10am.Service from staff at Kidderminster was first class,Thank you for a pleasant vist and a very speedy service.

title: Generally satisfied
body:
Happy once seen, but 25 minutes late going in, and had another appointment so worried I would then be late and miss it.
Staff seen very polite and helpful though

author: Fradk68
title: I really don't know how to get hold of this department
body:
I have been waiting to talk to someone from the musculoskeletal department for the last few years now. I had been referred from my GP to this hospital few years ago. They gave me appointment 8 months later to talk to me at specific time but they never actually call me and send me automated message stating that I missed appointment and reschedule it for next 7 months later.  
Second time same thing happened. Last year I have been waiting literally near my phone and they did same again. I immediately called reception and only thing they did is apologise and reschedule my appointment for another 8 months later.  
Having already had a terrible experience of this department, I called the hospital a day before my appointment to make sure someone will call me at specific time of appointment, which was at 11 am.  
Because of my job it was difficult for me to have appointment at that time, however I had already made arrangement to keep myself free. Nobody called me until 12:15, I missed the call as it was too late for me to receive the call as I was back at work at that time.  
I really don't know how to get hold of this department while I am suffering.

title: Not impressed
body:
Very disappointed not to have been able to see a GP for face to face appoint since joining practice last october , I have high blood pressure & recently diagnosed type 2 diabetic 
I have already changed to new surgery & would not recommend the Alney practice , chelt Rd surgery needs a drastic refurb , it’s like stepping back to the 60,s.& has no parking .
Takes on average 45 mins  to have your call answered

title: Very suppirtive
body: Phoned up with sensitive issues. Was very upset when I called. And the staff kept me calmed and listened. Gave me a call back an hour later. The GP  listened to me even thought I couldn't get the right words out. totally understood and gave me options on my next steps. 5 minute call went from been upset to relieved.

title: Obstructive and unhelpful
body:
Awful. Refused to refer a child for an autism assessment on the basis they don't know them personally. But they'll refer adults they also don't know personally for the same assessment.
They have refused to issue my daughter a fit note, without it she will lose her job. They are saying they don't do it which is rubbish because their website says they do. Her workmates have been issued the same note by their GPs with no issue. She is being told different things every time she contacts them, nobody seems to know what's going on.
This practice needs to seriously improve how they treat their patients.

title: Denied to see the doctor
body: I am exempt to wear a mask and got a saver asthma and I told them but they didn’t let me see the doctor and the doctor them self they didn’t want to see me as well how sad this world have become. I pay tax and NI and that’s how we get the service when we are not well

title: Lovely staff, very efficient process
body: I attended Woodlands for a cataract removal procedure. I was there for nearly 3 hours. Whilst I was there,  I never felt that I was just left alone- the nurses were lovely, attentive and efficient. The procedure only took about 20 minutes - in between my BP was taken, nurses explained what was going to happen , a cup of tea was made for me. In preparation for the procedure , the nurse kept asking if I was ok, she made sure I was comfortable. After the procedure my  BP was taken again.  A nurse went through aftercare. Another cup of tea was made for me. It all went very smoothly. I appreciated the care I received.

title: No appointment in last 5 years put June 21 as…
body: I prefer to attend Nutgrove Villa Walk-In Centre as the service is excellent. I have needed to see a GP since Oct 2021, but as far as I am aware no face to face appointments have been offered at Park House until maybe just recently. I am in constant pain, as I work full time getting an appointment is nigh on impossible.

title: Inability to reach your GP or send an econsult
body: Sadly the infrastructure to make an appointment online or even send an econsult is sorely lacking. Lunchtime and the practice has already reached capacity to even send an econsult. No online service to make an appointment with a GP. They make it so hard for you to make an appointment you give up. Unless you are free to wait on hold for an hour to get through on the telephone to speak to someone you are unlikely to get an appointment in the next month.  Worrying that you cant even reach your GP, they make it near on impossible to do so.

author: Kneeboy
title: A first class clinical care experience
body:
I was delighted to at last attend the new NTC for my Total Knee Replacement, arriving at 07.30 and longing for the magic to be worked to remove the pain and discomfort that had been hanging over me.  
The staff at the ward welcomed me and immediately made me feel at ease, but it was then a revolving door of clinical staff coming and going, all of them asking lots of questions - nursing staff to start with, closely followed by Mr. Annan (the man with the magic) and then there was the Anaesthetist. I was second on the list so not long to wait.  
Once it’s your turn it’s up and away and it all worked so smoothly, with the theatre team all at attention and ready to rock and roll. Before you know it you’re in recovery and soon heading back to the ward where the nursing staff were ready to oblige with the anticipated cup of NHS coffee … marvellous!  
The evening meal was sweet and sour chicken, which I must say was very tasty, very hot and much appreciated- a big well done for a tough job. The unit is also sparkling clean, so well done to the domestic staff and the cheery Porter who took me for my X-ray.  
I really can’t say enough about how well it all happened, with the Surgeon Mr. Annan and his assistant visiting me later in the day after theatre and first thing the next morning.  
I was duly discharged the next day but not until Andy the Physio visited to get me up and moving and tackling the staircase….!! The Occupational Therapist also checked in on me prior to discharge and all was good to go with the carry out medicines (they have indeed been required!!).  
So it’s a really big thank you from me for a first class clinical care experience and how us Fifers are now so lucky to have such a state of the art facility.

title: Awful service
body: Went to the surgery some 8 moths ago with a minor skin issue. Diagnosed and sent on my way. tried to get a repeat prescription to be given a different diagnosis. Fast forward to present day. I have had a total of 5 or 6 consultations re this issue (all but the first via the phone) This has a resulted in 5 or 6 totally different diagnosis!!! Having finally been referred to a specialist, again via the internet, I've been told diagnosis number 7, an incredibly common issue. Then, just to make this process especially irritating, it took a visit to the surgery, 3 weeks after diagnosis number 7, to get a prescription and treatment plan when they had not even bothered to contact me about. So, in nearly 8 months, I had a single face to face with staff, 5 or 6 telephone consults and finally an internet consult with a specialist to be told that it was a very common issue that should have picked up on my first visit! Avoid.

title: Great consultation
body: The consultation examination thorough, positive and constructive. All test and procedures carried out. All administrative notes taken and passed into the system.

title: Excellent service!
body:
I spent 10 days in the CCU and was really pleased with the care I received!

The nurses and care staff were friendly and competent, and the doctors very patient and empathetic. They took the time to explain my condition, treatment options and the next steps.

As a pleasant surprise, the food quality was good too :)

title: Great practice
body: Very friendly staff with great professionalism. Punctual and informative when the doctor was running a bit late.

author: Satisfied.
title: I was extremely satisfied with my experience
body:
I had an appointment to have surgery for my groin hernia.  
I received a call to ask if I could go over earlier as there had been a cancellation.  
I did so and was met with a huge smile by Amy, immediately putting me at ease.  
I was taken straight through to the daycare ward. From then on everything was speedy and efficient. A Nurse took all details and ensured that I was comfortable, the anaesthetist provided relevant information and the surgeon examined me prior to surgery. He was very caring and I was very reassured.  
After surgery I was provided with food and drink and excellent care.  
I was given a telephone to call my wife. I was also given great advice regarding what to do and when.  
Since coming home my wife changed my dressing. My wound is lovely and clean and a seamstress would be proud of the stitching.  
I have no pain, only a little discomfort sitting down or getting up from sitting position.  
All in all, I was extremely satisfied with my experience at University Hospital Wishaw. Congratulations to all!  
Only negative... having to navigate through the clouds of smoke at the main door both going in and coming out! People, both patients and visitors smoking right beside the 'no smoking' signs!

author: Oscar23
title: All staff very helpful
body:
Went to the eye care centre at Treliske Hospital in Truro. All staff very helpful and manage to see me very promptly. Was helped by Louisa who removed a bit of metal from my right eye.  
Procedure carried out quickly and efficiently with no pain. Louisa’s care was excellent and all sorted out with minimum fuss.  
A credit to the NHS.

author: tucanaqd36
title: Time waiting
body:
In general, service and attention by all NHS staff cannot be faulted.  
What could be better:  
The worst bit about it all was the time I had to wait for procedures to happen.  
Entered A&E Emergency Care ward. Told I needed angiogram (ultrasound first). Ultrasound didn't happen until four days later.  
I felt well enough to go home over the weekend and could have freed up a bed.  
From Wishaw, taken to Hairmyers. Waited 7 hours for transport (ambulance) availability - could have arranged my own transport.  
2 days of nothing happening.At present awaiting angiogram which should happen today, but no guarantee.

title: Grea Doctor
body: The GP fill with me very quickly and they are really helpful the doctors ar amizing and they are soo helpful

title: Great doctors, amazing nurse but rude reception…
body:
I have been with the practice for over ten years. 

I would give 5 stars to the doctors and nurses. But not one star to the reception staff. This is not a recent issue but was the case well before the pandemic.

My most recent gripe is that when the nurse or doctor has asked you to make an in-person appointment why shout at me on the phone?

title: MDT Diabetes clinics
body: While I am fully supportive of an MDT approach, I felt that my diabetes appointment yesterday was not the way to do it. This was my annual type 1 diabetes review with the consultant, and there was also a dietician and a nurse there. I found that the dietician was a distraction, she clearly did not like the diet I have (low carb, high in fruit and fresh vegetables) and we spent more time talking about my diet than we did on my recent blood tests that my GP and I were concerned about. The doctor was not concerned about my diet and even commented so, and I won't be changing it. I think it would have been better to have a separate appointment with the dietician rather than taking so much of my time with the consultant.

title: Long wait
body: Had a appointment with the nurse for a  routine blood test and blood test at 12am finally got to see her at 12-45,there was no other patients waiting so why the wait??

title: Online system
body: Submitted a request to get an appointment I. Regards to my inhaler. I got a text message to book an appointment. However you cannot book future appoints and you have to ring at 8am. At this time I am driving to work and there is always a queue and it is not feesable to stay on hold for hours on end when I’m at work. And when I’m at work I cannot answer my phone. So there is no point on the online system if it cannot help….

title: A doctors surgery run by receptionist
body: Possibly the hardest doctors in the uk to get an appointment with!.  You have to call each morning and afternoon and hope that an appointment is available, there rarely is. You cannot book a routine appointment. The amount of times I've ended up in Warwick accident and emergency because it's impossible to see a gp (they tell you to call 111 who then send you)  is insane.  I have genuine health concerns that I need to see someone about (chest pains and tiredness), but have given up trying to book something.  Its almost like the entire surgery is run by the receptionists.   If you have a spare 20 minutes then give them a call to be greeted with an insanely long voicemail which does everything it can to stop people trying to book an appointment.

title: Helpful
body: I have only been with this Practice since July last year (2022) but have always found the receptionists very friendly and helpful. Thank you.

title: Unable to get an appointment
body: After two months of ringing every morning at 8am on the dot, I have been unable to get an appointment.  As even 10th in the queue means that all the appointments for the day have apparently gone

title: Great service
body:
I attended for Mri scan & the staff couldn't have been more friendly, helpful
Certainly put me at ease

readBy.name: Salford Royal NHS Foundation Trust (Renal AQuA)

title: Great practice
body: Went for Covid jab had on time with no problems. My wife was worried about a place on her face mentioned to receptionist, she went and  saw a doctor who called my wife in straight away . Could not be better than that. Thank you

author: aoiy23
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The nurses were incredibly attentive
body:
Today, I underwent a minor surgical procedure in a rather sensitive area, which left me feeling anxious and self-conscious. However, I was pleasantly surprised by the exceptional care and consideration shown to me by the medical professionals at the day surgery unit.  
The staff in this department truly exceeded my expectations. To begin with, one of the doctors accompanied me to the operating theatre. During our short walk, he took the initiative to inquire about my hobbies which took my mind off things.  
The nurses were incredibly attentive, constantly checking in on me and inquiring about my well-being.  
I can confidently say that this hospital and its exceptional team deserve a perfect score of 10/10. Their professionalism, kindness, and dedication made my experience in the day surgery unit truly exceptional.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
